abstract.text: Asks a code host to identify one of its guests given the type and value of specific attributes of the guest code.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A valid code object representing code running on the system that acts as a host for signed code. Pass
to indicate that the code signing root of trust (currently, the system kernel) should be used as the code host.
A dictionary containing zero or more attribute values to be used in identifying guest code. See

for possible dictionary keys and descriptions of the associated values. Each host supports only particular combinations of keys and values, and the function returns an error if any unsupported set is requested. Pass

to indicate an empty attribute set. Note that some hosts that support hosting chains (guests being hosts) may return sub-guests to this function; that is, the code object returned by this call may not be a direct guest of the queried host, although it will be a guest somewhere in the hosting chain.
Optional flags; see
for possible values. Pass
for standard behavior.

On return, a code object identifying the particular guest of the host that has the specified attribute values. If the attributes specify the host itself, the function returns the code object for the host. If more than one guest meet the specified criteria, the function returns the result
A result code. See
. In particular:
The host does not support the specified attribute type.
The type of value given for a guest attribute is not supported by the host.
The host has no guest with the specified attribute value, even though the value is of a supported type. This error may also be returned if the code specified in the
parameter is not currently acting as a code host.
The code specified in the
parameter cannot act as a code host, because itâ€™s missing the
option flag in its code signature.
The attributes specified do not unambiguously identify a guest (the specification is not unique).

Different hosts support different types and combinations of attributes. The methods a host uses to identify, separate, and control its guests are specific to each type of host. This function provides a generic abstraction layer that allows uniform interrogation of all hosts.
The most frequent use of this function is to obtain a code object for specific code. To do that, pass
for the

parameter and specify all the attributes you have for the guest. You can also use this function to crawl through the guest hosting structure in incremental steps. To do so, pass in a specific host and the attributes for a particular guest.

abstract.text: Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.
Values that can be used in the
parameter to most code signing functions.
No flags (use the default behavior).
A code object representing signed code running on the system.
Asks a code host to identify one of its guests given the type and value of specific attributes of the guest code.
Retrieves the code object for the host of specified guest code.
Retrieves the code object for the code making the call.
Returns a static code object representing the on-disk version of the given running code.
May host guest code.
Recognize result codes specific to the code signing services API.
An attribute value associated with a key is out of range or is the wrong type.
Code signing host has more than one block of guest code with this attribute value.
Code signing host has no guest code with the requested attributes.
This code is not a code signing host.
Cannot locate guest code using this attribute set.
Specify attributes of guest code.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
